intro: Thyrsanthus glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth thyrsanthus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, often in sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually smooth and woody. Thyrsanthus glabrescens is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
